title: Watercress, Endive And Pear Salad
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Watercress, Endive And Pear Salad a try. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 recipe has 188 calories, 2g of protein, and 15g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 8. For 75 cents per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 5 people were impressed by this recipe. If you have belgian endive, watercress, but pears, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 21 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 64%. This score is solid. Similar recipes are Endive Watercress Salad, Watercress & Endive Salad, and Red Endive and Watercress Salad.
